contentrichtext.text: '''John Louis DiGaetani''' (born 1943)<ref>DiGaetani, John Louis, [http://muse.jhu.edu/login?uri=/journals/opera_quarterly/v021/21.2digaetani.html "''Richard Wagner: The Last of the Titans'' (review)"], ''The Opera Quarterly'', Volume 21, Number 2, Spring 2005, pp. 380-382</ref> is a [[Professor]] of English at [[Hofstra University]] in [[Hempstead (village), New York|Hempstead, New York]].<ref>Buller, Jeffrey L., [http://muse.jhu.edu/journals/opq/summary/v021/21.2buller.html "Wagner and Suicide (review)"], ''The Opera Quarterly'', Volume 21, Number 2, Spring 2005, pp. 376-380</ref> He received his [[Bachelor of Arts|BA]] from the [[University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign]], his [[Master's degree|MA]] from [[Northern Illinois University]], and his [[Doctor of Philosophy|Ph.D.]] from the [[University of Wisconsin–Madison]]. DiGaetani's published works include studies on modern [[British literature]], modern [[American literature]], [[opera]], and the connections between literature and music. He is also director of Hofstra's London Program. He is the author of: *''Penetrating Wagner's "Ring"'' *''Richard Wagner and the Modern British Novel'' *''An Invitation to the Opera'' *''Puccini the Thinker'' *''A Search for a Postmodern Theater: Interviews with Contemporary Playwrights'' *''Inside the Ring: Essays on Wagner's Opera Cycle'' *''Wagner and Suicide'' *''A Companion to Pirandello Studies'' *''Carlo Gozzi: A Life'' ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://people.hofstra.edu/John_L_DiGaetani/ Staff biography: John L.
